text: Edith Loudon (born 15 February 1964 in Perth, Scotland) is a Scottish curler, a . She played for Great Britain at the 1998 Winter Olympics. She was a member of an expert group in the World Curling Federation, who explained what kind of curling could be added as a second medal discipline to the Winter Olympics, concluding that it should be mixed doubles curling. ==Teams== ===Women's=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
